Sensing the approximate position of the spark in his own, AzureBlade 
felt it becoming clearer and clearer. Soon, he was flying above the 
forest in which he felt it vibrating with life.

AzureBlade: Dragon mode!

His jet wings unhooked from the main body, becoming slightly more 
dragon-like, his dragon head extended from the jet, still attached by 
a series of complex rings. Claws deployed and dug in the ground as he 
landed, and his tail extended, brushing the moist forest terrain. He 
heard some wolves howl.

AzureBlade: Noble beasts... True warriors, never losing their faith. 
Killing only those who need to be killed... The Maximals should take 
example on you.

After some moments walking in the forest, he saw a cave. He had 
damaged some trees accidentally, so he knew he would be waited for.

AzureBlade: Greetings, my friend. I am AzureBlade, and I truly come in 
peace.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., HanaKirei85@a... wrote:
> <<> AzureBlade: Wait for me! I am coming to meet you!
> > 
> > He blasts full speed towards the spark.>>
> 
> Mistra lined up carefully with the status pod, so as to push it by 
her 
> shoulder. Hopefully she was big enough...her stature was small and 
light when 
> it came down to it. Taking in a deep breath, she charged foward to 
push with 
> all her weight...
> 
> ...and was nursing a throbbing shoulder a moment later, after 
tumbling 
> backwards a few feet. Muttering some words under her breath that are 
better 
> off not repeated, she moved foward again, pushing in place with her 
shoulder. 
> 
> Seeing soon this wasn't getting her anywhere, since the pod hadn't 
budged in 
> the least, Mistra sighed and sat down beside it, glaring in its 
general 
> direction. Great. Just great. 
> 
> "If I just knew my activation code...then I could transform and move 
this 
> damn thing no problem. I think anyway.." Not that she could remember 
just 
> what her actual form looked like. For all she knew, she maybe just 
as small...
> 
> Snarling slightly in annoyance, she kicked a small stone towards the 
pod, 
> then looked out towards the sky. Maybe she should just forget the 
status pod 
> and move on...why would anyone want to steal it anyway? There may 
not even be 
> another soul on this planet...even if there was, what use would her 
pod be to 
> them? But..then again...
